Reviews.Title: “Solid budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Praga while visiting friends who live in the neighborhood and found it to be a good value and a pleasant place to stay. I think it would be a relatively good location for any traveler coming to Madrid who doesn't mind being slightly away from the city center. As other reviewers noted, it's a pleasant walk or easy bus ride to all the main sights, and the surrounding neighborhood has good stores and restaurants- it's a real neighborhood where Madrilenos live, and you also have the newly completed riverwalk, which we enjoyed walking along. We enjoyed having the breakfast buffet and found the staff pleasant. As elsewhere in Spain, you will have an easier time if you speak a bit of Spanish- we observed some others struggling to communicate with staff. The wifi seemed a bit expensive and you also had to pay to use the safe in the room, but we still felt it was a good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Konstantin V
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, 10 minutes from underground station. There are supermarket and shops near the hotel. Rooms are nice and clean, breakfast is also good. I recommend this hotel for few days in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerome_in_london
Reviews.Content: Not a 5 star wasn't expecting one. Close to subway. Nice park just behind hotel. Lots of shops and restaurants close by. We were part of Cosmos tour and arrived early morning. Even though we had been warned we wouldn't be allowed to check in till after 3:00 PM, they still allowed us to check in early. The one elevator around the corner from the others is much less busy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a charming city”
Reviews.Author: Demandingtraveler067
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated close to the center of Madrid. You can walk to the Plaza Real in twenty five minutes through a charming area or you can take bus line 23 which leaves you there in ten minutes. I recommend the walking, as you can see this part of town and it’s a pleasant experience. From there you can walk to the Puerta del Sol as well as all the important points in the city. The breakfast in the hotel is excellent, and it is normally included with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very busy 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ufo_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a total of 6 nights in May 2012. We were meeting up with a Cosmo tour group for Spain , Portugal. and Morocco. Our first 4 nights were spent in a dreary room on the 1st floor overlooking another building. We were kept a wake several nights when a group of young people ran up and down the hallways and slammed doors until the wee hours. Many groups stay at this budget hotel. We had booked and paid for breakfast ahead of time and it was very good in the main dining room. Once we joined our tour groupo breakfast was now in a banquet rooms and was inferior to what we had experienced. Wifi is not free and you have to get a new code every 24hrs 4 euros what a pain! Front desk was less than helpful and when we inquired how to get to the Zoo we were told to take a taxi. When we returned from our tour we spent one more night here and it was on the 5th floor, the room was on the corner and sunlit. What a difference from that first room which was dark and dreary. The hotel is reasonably convenient and the 23 bus will take you to Plaza Mayor for 1.50 euro. The Metro is also walking distance and we had no trouble venturing to Toledo on the Metro and train. Museums and other main sights are accessible by metro and bus 20-30min. There are several restaurants in the area watch out for the bread and other offerings olaced on the table they are not free! A solid three star hotel and reasonable for the capital City!

Reviews.Title: “Wifi is not free”
Reviews.Author: TeeTeeDee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is patronized by many tour groups so at times it can be quite noisy, the front desk busy and the small lobby congested with guests and their luggage. It is just out of the city centre. However bus to Plaza Mayor is at the door. Metro station is about 5 to10 minutes away. Be very vigilant however. There are many pickpockets in buses, metros and all crowded places in Madrid and other big cities. Local people warned us many times that their pickpockets are among the best of the best (in their profession). We were almost robbed when in a queue going through the turnstide of a metro station. There are many shops, supermarkets, restaurants, bars and ATM machines on the street in front of the hotel. We were told that some of the ATM machines near the hotel were tempered with and consequently some travellers had their bank accounts raided recently. So as a precaution use those machines that are further away from the hotel. The hotel is dated. There is no outstanding features to say about the hotel. Room conditions and services are just average, acceptable. What we don't like is that it charges for the wifi service. These days we can get such service for free in many bars, restaurants and public places. Hope that some future reviewers will report that the hotel follows the practice of their competitors and makes such service free for the convenience of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pachappa2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning and end of a Cosmos tour. The hotel is in a residential neighborhood, with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. It's an easy bus ride to the Plaza Mayor and an easy walk to/from the bus stop for downtown and Prado museum. There is a market almost next door that sells food, water and alcohol. Previous reviews complained about the staff; we found them to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel is used by various tour groups so the lobby does get crowded. WiFi is expensive 4 euros a day. The breakfast buffet was good. Rooms are a bit small but clean and adequate. We had one with a small balcony on the 7th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid is great, it's people and places, i.e. this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelpnut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before we returned to the U.S. and it was splendid. We were next (around the corner from the famous Museo de Jamon (Ham museum) and the food there was delicious; I paid $1 U.S. for a great subway like sandwich with authentic spanish ham plus tomato's (which you have to pay extra for). So, we only had one meal at the hotel which was very tasty. The service was excellent with courteous employees eager to make us feel welcome. They have internet and helped us find a flamenco show. It was also of course situated near famous El Prado Museum and Reina Sofia Modern Art museum. The plaza across the way also had informal eateries, great beer at the outdoor patio next to Sofia museum, and other nice tourist traps that didn't trap you too badly! The hotel was very clean and the price was really reasonable for its proximity to great places and great food.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little place off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: lovestoroam78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very popular with tour groups - probably because it is a good value for the money and it is very well run. It is in a residential neighborhood but easily accessible via bus (Rte 23) or the Metra (Green line). The park behind it is a treasure - take an early morning or late evening walk for a pleasant getaway. The rooms are OK - but clean and well maintained. The TVs are old - but they do have a clock display - which is missing in the other hotels we stayed on this trip, The front desk was very helpful when we needed to fax a document to the states, and we also kept a few bags in storage (6 Euro ea) when we left for a few days. The best part of the hotel is the street it is on. Quite a few topas restaraunts and local bars. Not the kind where you see alot of tourists - but they treated us well when we showed up, The tour groups cause a buzz in the smallish lobby, and the busses clog the street - but other than that - this is a nice litttle slice of Madrid life,

Reviews.Title: “Felt asleep in the bath”
Reviews.Author: MyselfLondonLondon
Reviews.Content: Relaxed so much that even felt asleep in the bath, Got some room service and it was very quick. No one really speaks english but who does in Spain? Is close to a great line of the metro and the rooms are clean. A bit dated but nice. beats the small and expensive places in the city town. Went out clubbing and even managed to get a bus back to the hotel in the middle of the night

Reviews.Title: “Praga Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a present for my son and his girlfriend and paid for it in advance, they found he biggest problem they had was on check in the hotel asked for the card that the payment was made with as I was not there this caused a problem. They were eventually told they could check in but the phone in the room would be disconected and they would not be able to have any room service or tv. This did spoil their stay and should have been explained a the time of booking

Reviews.Title: “value, in residential area.”
Reviews.Author: scenic2010
Reviews.Content: A lot of stores, restaurants in area frequented by locals so they were cheaper at prices for middle class locals. A block from main city river with pleasant clean recreation, children playgrounds, jogging paths, etc. along both banks which were 10 Km. long as told by tour guide. Near one professional soccer stadium. Taxi easy to find ans buslines avaialble. Taxi rides about 7-8 euros to The most popular ares of world class museums, Retiro park, busy business districts and governmental offices.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised :o)”
Reviews.Author: MissAmyYa
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Groupon for a hen party and visited this weekend during the heat wave. My colleagues who are Spanish locals said the weather was unusual for May but we loved it! We were thankful that this hotel had aircon! We arrived at the hotel at 1pm and they let us check in early with no troubles at all. One of my party had forgotten to print out her return journey boarding pass for our ryan air flight and the hotel staff kindly printed it for her..... but she had to pay the four euros for the 1hr internet access! They also gave me a free map which came in very handy and I used this to navigate where everything was with the help of my colleagues. We had 3 twin rooms which were clean, nice, offered towels, a wardrobe, and two of the rooms had balonies. Unfortunately our hair dryer didn't work but otherwise the room was great. The room had a safe and cost 2 EUR per day to use, we all just used one together in our group. The room are cleaned daily, on our second day the cleaner knocked on our door as asked to clean our room. Since we were staying 2 nights only we told her we didn't need it cleaned and she still gave us clean towels and offered to empty bins anyway! Very nice service! I'd read that the hotel offered great breakfast but we didn't wake early enough and opted out. Instead, we bought croissants and tea from the pastry shop several doors away from the hotel and ate in the room. The location of this hotel was fine, it wasn't near the centre but it had a bus stop right outside the entrance which takes you into the town, Puerta del Sol. The journey only takes 15 mins max. and is a mere 1.50 EUR. Nearby is the nearest metro station Marqués de Vadillo which is a 10-15 minute walk away. The metro system was very easy to navigate around and is similar to the london tube. I bought tickets from the ticket machine which offered instructions in english and I bought a ticket for 10 journeys for 12 EUR. This includes journeys made on the buses too. At today's exchange rate, it's very cheap! Taxis were available at 4:30am outside the hotel to take us to the airport which was handy, we were worried there would be none so early! It was only 30 EUR and the taxis were metered. We made trip one night from Puerta del Sol back to the hotel in a taxi and it was only 8 EUR. All in all, we had no complaints about this hotel at all. I've read reviews that say this hotel is 'in the middle of nowhere' but with a little map reading and some brain power, you'll find it's easy to get around and it's worth staying somewhere a little further away in order to stay in a hotel that is very good value.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: BAHPANTS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel back in April and found it an interesting experience, when we got dropped off, the taxi driver advised us never to keep anything in our back pockets and always keep an eye on your bag. Not really an issue if you're careful. The rooms themselves were pretty good, we booked a double room and got two single beds pushed together. The bathroom was lovely, really clean and spacious, the maids came and cleaned the room everyday. The hotel wasn't exactly in a central location, more a local area, however, this isn't really an issue once you work out the metro station. The reception staff weren't very helpful with this, we asked where the nearest metro station was and we were just handed a leaflet with a map. The nearest metro station is Marques de Vadillo, if you turn right out of the hotel and walk right to the top of the road you will see it. I would probably recommend this hotel, however, if you are looking for a central location then maybe look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting experience”
Reviews.Author: SS99_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here privately for a couple of nights before and after a Cosmo tour. For those travelling, make sure you book privately, rather than add on to the tour. Firstly, they charge way more than the internet, and secondly you get directed towards a completely sub-standard dining room catering for the bulk of tour groups! When we stayed privately, I would rate the breakfast as fantastic. Heaps of fresh fruit and a huge variety of pastries, cereals and you name it, they had it. It was so disappointing to return the following morning, be redirected to the tour dining room, and see the tinned fruit, powdered milk and powdered juice. It was very sad! In regards to the stay, it was an interesting time. The doors are very thin, so you get woken up by people coming and going at all hours of the night and day. The bus number 23 is right outside the door and took between 10 and 30 minutes to get to the city centre. What I really loved about this motel was the location. Others have rubbished it because the motel was out of the CBD, I thought this was one of the best features of the motel. By being in a working class area, the (numerous) bars and restaurants along the street are filled with locals and not too many tourists. This way, we sampled authentic cuisine and really got to know the 'real' Spain. There are some good clothes shops nearby and plenty of other shopping. And the huge bonus, there aren't heaps of tourists around the area! There are instructions on another forum on trip advisor that gives intstructions on how to get to the motel using the metro (from the airport) - much cheaper than bus transfers or taxi! Our tour guides did mention to be very careful of pickpockets on the metro and the local bus - although we didn't experience any of that.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: FraFrolik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five days we spent as a holiday in Madrid in mid April. Good choice was to buy breakfest for 8,-Eur (buffet with lot of fruits, sweets, jamon,cheese, muesli, scrambled eggs, bacon etc.) The three course "menu del dia" we tried once during our stay and it was very tasty and cheap - 10,-Eur. Because we purchased the hotel over the server otel.com as a non refundable deal, we did not expect any superior room.In fgact it was very good - clean,quite comfortable, but not large.The window was oriented into small atrium or even skylight - a little bit confined view, but no traffic noise from the street. Bus stop (Nr23) direct in front of hotel, you can go to the subway Marques de Vadillo or direct to the Plaza Mayor by bus in cca 25 min. For tourists, who go out early in the morning and come back late evening to sleep only is this hotel good choice, very valuable for the money you spent for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyT0urists
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Praga in April, 2012 for two days while on a Cosmo tour. Found the hotel to be very clean. Rooms were spacious. Good AC and the windows opened for fresh air and with little traffic noise as we were on the 6th floor. We found the staff to be both polite and helpful (albeit, they are very formal and no one seems to smile...might be a spanish culture thing.) The bathroom was of good size and VERY clean. The beds were of good quality and comfortable. Breakfasts (2) were generous and excellent, there was something for everyone. The tour dinner was of good quality, however it was not from the normal hotel menu. The Hotel is what one would expect for a tour hotel. To accomodate tour buses the location is a bit far out, however City bus-23 stops out front. We took a taxi to the Prado for about $15 do to Health and time constraints. The Praga is located in a nice, safe, inexpensive neighborhood with lots of shops and good tapas bars. Great bakery next door. We recommend The Hotel Prada.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lhawley77
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect from the hotel given its price (~40 GBP per night for a double room, exc breakfast) but the other TA reviews suggested it was worth a go. I visited with my parents and we were very pleased with our choice. A little way out of the centre the bus stop is directly outside the hotel, and is only ~15 mins drive to Plaza Mayor. The rooms were comfortable and clean, and the staff at the front desk happy to help and advise e.g. places to go. There is also a taxi rank outside, and Barajas airport was about a 20 minute drive. You can also get around by metro, but it's not quite as convenient, being about 10 minute walk to the closest stop. Overall really excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: MalteseTravelBuff
Reviews.Content: Travelling the first time to a city without knowing where to book can be perplexing but this hotel looked somewhat appealing. It is very far from the centre of it all though close enough to the greatest flea market happening in Madrid ... The Rastro. The room was fine, nothing to write home about and we felt it did not deserve a four star category. We never tried the hotel's restaurant since the prices were exorbitant. There are plenty of small eateries in the same street as the hotel's with very friendly people, great food and not heavy on the pocket.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel-rude staff”
Reviews.Author: chrisgr4
Reviews.Content: booked for 1 night...we arrived at 14:00 and the rooms were not prepared...waited until 17:00 to enter the rooms and the next day they wanted extra 22e for late checkt out because we planned to leave at 17:00!!room was ok..from the room you can hear almost everything..the staff were very rude to us especially when we were waiting for our check in...most important they could not speak english!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not in center and not 4 worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: morten1morten
Reviews.Content: Don't let the 4 stars for this hotel fool you. This is by no standards - not even spanish - a 4 star hotel. The rooms are small and worn out and the level of service is not what you would expect from even a 3 star hotel. Other things you have to consider: The hotel describes it self as being located in central Madrid. This is not true. It is a 50-60 minut walk to Puerta del sol. There is a bus leaving outside the hotel to center which takes 15 minuttes but the hotel is not located in central Madrid. The WIFI is not included but costs 4 euros per day. If you get a good deal on hotwire or another webpage this hotel can be okay - if your okay with staying far from the center in a hotel that i reality should have 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: arj s
Reviews.Content: we went for a two day three break to Madrid and even though the location looks like it is out the way, it is very central, you are away from the busy streets but only a short (10min bus ride no. 23) the nearest metro is a lovely 8 min stroll where you pass some lovely food places and jamon deli places. Lots to do once there and as soon as you stare at a map for 10 mins everywhere is easy to walk to in the city. Hotel was clean and rooms were comfy, nothing fancy but large enough. For value this is a great offer, we got a taxi one night from the central square( Plazza Mayor) it cos 7 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Claire B
Reviews.Content: The staff were accommodating, friendly

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jillypink
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January for 2 nights at start of a Cosmos tour and again for 2 nights at end of tour. It's a basic hotel with no disabled facilities, even though they advertise that they do. Breakfasts OK, good choice. As it was winter it was warm in rooms but cool in breakfast room. Bus 23 stopped outside hotel which was very convenient. It went straight to Plaza Mayor. Used bus 3 or 4 times to go to La Latina (where my niece lives) and Plaza Mayor once. Various shops in area, supermarket and bakery close. Quite a long way from main sights but can catch bus.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Shashmi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Praga when we visited Madrid this January, 2012. I wasn't expecting much from the hotel from the reviews I had read on various review sites. But I was pleasantly surprised the hotel was real value for money. The best part about the hotel was the connectivity to the city. We got down at the metro station Marques De Vadillo, just 200 meters away was the bus stop where we got bus no. 23, which dropped us just infront of Hotel Praga. The reception is not a fancy one, but the hotel staff were good and could speak and understand English :) We had booked a double room, which I did find a bit small, but all we wanted the rooms were to spend the night and rest of the day was spent sightseeing, so wasn't much of an issue. The bathrooms were clean, they had a small TV in the room which atleast had CNN rest all were Spanish channels. The breakfast served was also good, they had many options but no baked beans or scrambled eggs which we did get in the hotel we stayed in Barcelona :) Overall I would say value for money, if you are not looking for a fancy hotel and just want one to sleep at night and have a decent breakfast in the morning, you might want to consider staying at Praga.

Reviews.Title: “Just about average..”
Reviews.Author: ShampaGD
Reviews.Content: Had stayed for 3 days. Located on the main street, next to a super market, it is convenient if you are in the city for work or business. For a tourist like me, the train station was a little further than i expected, and it took time to reach the main attractions of the city. The rooms were not very clean, the linen didnt appear fresh. Despite confirmed request for a street facing room, i was given a room that overlooked the drain pipes of the hotel and the neighbouring buildings. Bathroom was clean and well appointed. Reception staff was casual and definitely not keen to help who did not speak spanish. If I go back to Madrid, I would try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: JulieT061
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good for the price. We found it clean and the bathroom was fine.On the second night of a 3 day stay we found lots of teenagers staying in the rooms next to us being a little noisy,just talking and the doors banging until 2am.We asked to move the next morning and this was done with no problem. We did not have breakfast here as we prefer to eat out. We purchased a 3 day travel pass @ 13 euros and this included the bus and metro, also the metro back to the airport. Excellent value. Madrid is a lovely city and we plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: beachykeen70
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September as part of a Cosmos tour in a triple share room. The room was fine with 3 single beds and a nice enough bathroom. Breakfast was average. No free wi fi offered by the hotel, and the lobby was always full of large tour groups. The location was not impressive, being in a residential area and we did not feel safe walking around of a night. The local bus stops out the front, but I would prefer to stay closer to town.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Easy access to the city”
Reviews.Author: biribilis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is locarlted near the river that runs through madrid. The rooms are clean, the breakfast is quite good and the area around the hotel seems good too. I would recommend not to get to this hotel if you have a car cause the street parking seemed to be a little tedious. Outside the hitel there is a bus stops that can you can use to get to plaza mayor. Also about 7 minutes away by foot is a metro station that you can also use.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate. That's all.”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: Good stuff - Bus outside front door takes you to Plaza Mayor for 1.50 EURO. Beds are really comfortable. Rooms are decent. Beautiful park nearby for jogging. Plenty of markets and restaurants on Calle Antonio Lopez. Bad Stuff - Metro station is a very long walk from the hotel. With the exception of one person, the STAFF at this hotel is incredibly RUDE and NON-ACCOMODATING. Hotel caters to large groups and the line for breakfast was outrageous. You can imagine the wait time for an elevator! They charge for WIFI and the internet. Not near any of the major sites in Madrid. Airport access is not convenient. Most people take a taxi, unless you take a taxi to Atoche and then take the express bus. I do not recommend staying here. Find something near the Atoche train station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reed S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Praga on two separate occasions in November. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They charge 4 Euro for 24 hours of Internet, which was fine considering it had a good signal and high speed. There is a bus right outside the front door that will take you to the Plaza Major - the center of downtown. You can also catch the metro, which was a short 10-min walk to the hotel. We took the metro to and from the airport which is a 2 Euro fare (about 1 hour and 3 train changes...the taxis cost around 40 Euro), or you can get the "touisto abono" card for about 5 Euro a day that covers all modes of public transportation. There are two good food markets less than 30 seconds from the front door and several local restaurants along with Domino's Pizza and Burger King down the block. The breakfast in the hotel was fine with lots of cheese, meats, breads, scrambled eggs...... Overall, it was a nice hotel, and a good price and short bus ride to down town Madrid. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very happy!”
Reviews.Author: netdepa
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting this hotel many times in the last years and was always very happy of the service and the price. Rooms are big, clean ad well decorated. Price is very resonable, they should still have promotions betweem 50-60 Eur per night. Breakfast is very good. Location is OK and there is a subway station not far.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: 59Laura
Reviews.Content: I agree with other posts- there are nicer, more interesting places to stay in Madrid. This worked well for us because I needed a hotel where I could park a car. I got a deal that included parking and full breakfast for 80 Euros. This did not seem like a 4 star hotel. Nothing very outstanding or memorable. It did have the most comfortable beds compared to the other hotels on our trip. Walls thin. The #23 bus stops right in front of hotel taking you to Plaza Mayor which was very convenient. For one night, on our way to airport the next day it worked fine but if someone is sightseeing in Madrid I wouldn't pick this place.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable trip”
Reviews.Author: ansal01
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be clean and comfortable, although it is rather noisy if overlooking the street which seems to have police sirens going all night but if the windows are shut it does block out a lot of the noise. We only ate breakfast once at the hotel which was good value as all you can get elsewhere is toasted sandwiches! There is a bar called Praga just along from the hotel which is run by a lovely man called Salvatore - he speaks very good english and is always willing to help! We used the metro and found it very easy and all the stops in the centre seem to be a 5 minute walk from each other. Be prepared to do lots of walking!!! We didn't find the food to be particularly expensive and found a great chinese buffet just down from the plaza mayor towards La Latina station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: GinaR0
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 12 noon and after a long morning travelling were able to check in early- great bonus! All the staff we came accross were extremely helpful and the public areas and our room were all kept clean. There is a bus stop right outside and it takes 20 minutes to the Centre or a 5 minute walk to the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, but there's much better available in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Cottonsockz
Reviews.Content: Postives: Price, Plaza Mayor bus connection right outside, and plenty of convenience stores in the vicinity. Negatives: Room was basic, not particularly clean. Fine for basic accommodation, but there's better in Madrid, for not much more cost, in areas further north that are more convenient to sights and more transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Anne P
Reviews.Content: Good location with the number 23 bus to the city centre at the door;lots of bars and cafes close by; beautiful park with a splash pad and beach nearby; supermarkets too. Comfortable room, wide choice for breakfast and excellent service. We arrived after 11pm after a train trip from Bordeaux, France, were made very welcome at the hotel, dumped our bags and found a terrific bar along the street, full of locals including children, all watching the soccer on TV and happy to put up with our fractured Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Good But not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Newfcouple
Reviews.Content: We began and ended our tour here. Good location with supermarkets, fruitstands, and cafes nearby. Best part about location is the beautiful park directly in back along the Manzanares River. Great place for a romantic evening walk. Mostly families and couples are using it. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The lobby was always too crowdwd and noisy. More and better lifts are needed. Almost impossibe to get access to the two computers. Internet access overpriced. The waiters at the restaurant should be told that they are waiters not princes. But we found most waiters in spain very rude. The breakfast buffet was good but very crowded and chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JakiWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel and rooms clean, beds comfortable. We were opposite a Lidle so able to buy water and any other bits, Breakfast a little bit boring, and orange juice could have being any juice, but apart from that a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION. GOOD BREAKFAST BUFFET”
Reviews.Author: GegeMei
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a total of 4 nights for approximately $180 per night. It is an average hotel, not luxurious, no free wifi, but with a great breakfast buffet. It is clean and the area is safe. What I liked the most was the location. There are two bus stops in front of the hotel that take you to La Plaza Mayor (the city center). It is just a short 15 minute ride. Also, behind the hotel there is a huge beautiful park and also there are two nearby minimarkets where you can get snacks, and groceries if you need to. Overall a good deal for the price. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: KrisTravels2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Praga at the start and end of a Cosmos tour of Spain and so experienced two different rooms. The first room looked onto an interior courtyard so was quiet but dark. The bedroom furnishings were a bit outdated but comfortable, and the room was one of the largest we had on our trip. The bathroom was small but modern and clean. The second room had a balcony overlooking the street. I expected it to be noisy, but it was not, mainly because the hotel is situated in a residential area, rather than in downtown Madrid. That room was somewhat smaller than the first, but still comfortable. The beds in both rooms were very comfortable. Breakfasts were included and were served buffet-style. The quality of the food was average, but there was plenty of it. The hotel does not offer free wi-fi; however, I requested access and was not charged for it. The location isn't great if you don't want to waste time traveling to/from the main sights, but the #23 city bus stops right in front of the hotel and for 1 Euro, takes you to within a couple of blocks of the Plaza Mayor. As mentioned above, the hotel is situated in a residential area, which has its advantages--there was a grocery store less than a block away and a variety of restaurants. Overall, we were satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneSally
Reviews.Content: Understaffed reception area, with staff looking as if they were on the verge of a nervous breakdown, one even grinding his teeth. No helpful brochures or even a card with the hotel's name and address for taxis Nothing!. Limited English, despite hotel catering for bus loads of English speaking people! Two computers in foyer impossible to use because of poor lighting. Rooms clean but in desperate need of maintenance. Fridge door came off on to the floor, complete with rack of drink bottles. TV remote did not work despite polite request for replacement, consequently no television for three days. On the third day of my stay, I was robbed in dress shop a few doors down from hotel. Lost everything. My tour had finished and I was alone, prior to leaving for Rome the following day. I am 70 years of age. Approached reception staff for assistance. They could not have been less interested. Despite offering Platinum Credit Card, they refused to advance me the taxi fare to collect funds my family had forwarded to Madrid. Spent a sleepless night, without food or money, and extremely distressed. Stood out the front of the hotel with suitcases following morning at 5 a.m. hoping a taxi driver would accept card to get me to airport. One pleasant night staff reception person interpreted for me and I was successful. I have never been so pleased to leave a hotel in my life. (Be careful of the pick-pockets working in the street - not a pleasant area). .

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: 7madhouse
Reviews.Content: Hotel Praga was just outside the main centre of Madrid but easy enough to walk and there was a bus stop right outside the hotel that went into town.hotel was clean and tidy and comfortable beds.Staff were helpful too would stay here again. Madrid is a clean well kept city lots of parks fountains where you can people watch with a nice glass of wine and the Metro is so easy and the buses..But we walked a lot, then you get to see more.Read the reviews on here which were very helpful too..

Reviews.Title: “I love it”
Reviews.Author: pattysanson
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and very nice staff. Bus on the front door #23 restaurants, metrostation walking distance'

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and pleasantly surprising.”
Reviews.Author: SarahCraigLondon
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on trip advisor I must say my partner and myself were slightly apprehensive on arrival. However we were pleasantly surprised and think for the price we paid we done very well. As described the hotel is out of the main centre but it really is only a 20 min tube ride away. It’s a ten-minute walk through the residential area, which yes could be quite daunting if walking alone at night. But pretty safe at other times. Tube prices were very reasonable too and the metro links were very efficient. Back to the hotel. The staff are friendly and very helpful and always willing to provide you with all the information you required. Our rooms were cleaned every day during our 5-day stay. Comfortable and spacious they suited our needs. Yes you will only pick up one British channel; CNN and the films are no longer available. Minibar was replenished each day too. The only criticism would be that the walls are very thin and you will hear people walking around at night and in the mornings so advice would be to take earplugs!! We would happily return to Hotel Praga again should we visit Madrid a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, unsafe neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Chrissierulz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a Cosmos tour group last summer. The hotel itself was an average UK three-star hotel with clean rooms and its usual in-room facilities (showers, toiletries,towels, TV). There was no free wi-fi, and there was an additional charge for internet (two hotel laptops in the lobby), no visible firewall or anti-virus which makes online payments susceptible to the common internet security threats. Breakfast range wasn't fantastic (watery boiled eggs!) and indisputably tinned fruit cocktails (limited, if any, fresh fruits in the summer when I visited. Other hotels we visited offered a bountiful of fresh watermelons, oranges etc). We did not order in the restaurant since there were authentic tapa tabernas available on the streets. Location was not the most favorable as it was twenty to thirty minutes walk away from the city centre and it is located in quite a run-down neighborhood that is deserted during off-peak hours. It can be quite daunting for families to wander around even on the main streets during the siesta hours (self-defeating for bonafide city explorers). All the factors taken together, I would recommend tourists (if not in a tour group) to consider a hotel located in a central location for similar quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF YOU LIKE BEING ROBBED!!”
Reviews.Author: sam2010Leeds
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel so that we could visit the football stadiums in madrid, we were also going to see the football whilst we were there. the hotel staff knew this as our tickets were delivered to them, we went to the match and when we came back to our room our safe had been stolen, there was no forced entry into the room, and having checked about 10 times before we left we know it was locked!! an inside job could be the only answer, staff didnt care about the distress we were in, they refused to let us see the cctv as if they had something to hide, they made us pay for the safe even though we had all our possessions stolen, and they refused to change our room. horrible hotel, HORRIBLE STAFF, HORRIBLE BREAK!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: dandydons1903
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with mates so we where not after anything amazing. this hotel is a 4 star and i would say that it lives up to the 4 stars it has been awarded. it is around a 30 minute walk from the centre of madrid and is situated very close to the Calderon staduim. if you are looking for a better location the you pay the price, a taxi into the puerto del sol cost around 7 euros. the hotel was always very clean and the rooms cleaned daily. highly recomened if you are looking for a weekend away but want to aviod paying through the nose for city centre location.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with 0 % customer service”
Reviews.Author: sunshine_carolina
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at Praga Hotel for 4 nights , 15th April - 19th April 2011. It was for us a short break in Madrid , and he managed to compete at the Madrid marathon. Check in time was around 5-7 mins. The room looked quite clean , average size , bathroom with nice marble , good shower and hot water even early hours in the morning.We asked for a top floor and we got a room on 5th floor with a veritable view of local flats. Be aware that they charge you for everything! The funny part was that we actually had an 80`s safe in the room however if you want to use it they will ask you for 20 euros as safety deposit + 2 euros per day for use! In a 4 star hotel with such an old safe and this ridiculous prices?! Let`s be serious ! We wanted to use internet wi-fi but of course they want money :)) 4 euros for 24/hours. As I wanted just to check my e-mails for a few minutes , I called reception to give some more information about their business center! Guess what ?! I called around mid day sunday and the lady said , well I am not sure if it is open now but there is an internet cafe across the street haha :)) I got downstairs and asked a few members of staff where is the business center they barely speak english! Luckily the reception manager was around and explain to me that again I have to pay 4 euros to use their business center , price per hour. To be honest I was so happy they haven`t charge us for using water or toiler roll :)) We do not try any of F&B outlets , so I can not review. However there are plenty of shops around this hotel such as Carrefour express , Lidl , pizza for take away etc. Location is quite strange , around 1 km for the nearest tube station, or if you fancy a ride with some local pensioners take bus 33 which have a stop just outside the hotel and have final destination Plaza Mayor.Overall the area is pretty safe as we came late from town and nothing happened :) However is comparable let`s say with Brixton in south London... I would recommend for getting around , the tourist card which you can buy online and collect straight from information center in Barajas Airport. Do not expect any smile or customer service at this hotel , at the check out I simple handed over the key , the lady asked room service used ? No...(astronomic prices as well) and that`s it...No questions if we enjoyed our stay or anything else. At the of the review I just recommend to do more research and I bet anyone could find a better place to stay and closer to city center....We learnt our lesson now.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: fonejacker
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a four night stay at the Praga, and overall the hotel was what we were expecting. The reception area seems to have been recently refurbished and is fitting of a four star property, but that's where it ends I'm afraid. The rooms, whilst clean, are a little dated and on the small side - and have to agree with others that the cleaners are far too noisy to be working in a hotel environment. Also, you shouldn't really expect to hear the people in the next room having a normal conversation, or flushing the toilet. But I don't want to appear too negative! I wouldn't not reccommend this hotel, but there might be better ones out there (we just didn't spend too long searching....). The staff are friendly and helpful, and the area around the hotel is generally non-offensive. We h225ad previously seen reviews here that said the metro was five minutes walk away, but it's more like 10-12 mins walking - so if you get the metro from the airport, perhaps it might be better to catch the no 23 bus from the corner of c/Antonio Lopez (it's then just two stops to the hotel). When you've ditched the suitcase, walking to and from the metro is no real issue. So overall, we were satisfied with what we received for the price - we paid just over £500 for 4 nights stay plus last minute flights - but do bear in mind the points that are consistently raised before committing.

Reviews.Title: “basic and noisey”
Reviews.Author: huvu2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 15 miles from the airport, so unless you are on an organised trip with transfers included,a taxi will cost 50 + euros. the hotel itself is dated and in need of modernisation, the rooms are small ,our room was 9 ft x 12 ft and the bathroom 4 ft x 12 ft.. there was not nenough space to move once we brought the luggage in. This hotel is by far the noisiest we have ever stayed in, large gaps between the doors and the floor mean that any noise from the corridor seems like it is in the room with you. The maids start cleaning at 7.30 and and virtually scream at each other, so if you need a rest after a long journey forget it. It is a minimum of 15 minutes walk to the metrro and then another 15 minutes once you get on the train, If you are on a city break dont stay here because if you do you will spend most of your time working out how to get back and to from the main attractions,

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, clean room and friendly helpful staff .”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: very convenient location close to metro and with bus no. 23 stopping outside door! takes about half an hour to walk to the center from hotel if you are fit! try taberna de dominguez opposite marquis de vadillo metro ( cross at lights with the river facing you and go right along calle antonio de lopez) for delicious food great house wines and the best lager in madrid! the staff there really made our stay especially anna the waitress.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location for budget travelers - don't expect the 4-star though”
Reviews.Author: Mondalo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an easy 5-minute walk from the Marques Vadillo metro stop (though despite being close to the sketchy Usera neighborhood, it seemed pretty safe to walk there even during dark hours). But we ended up taking the No. 23 bus which had a stop right in front of the hotel, which conveniently takes you right to Plaza Mayor. The rooms themselves were of average quality - we were sleeping just fine. They were clean and reasonably quiet for being near busy traffic. Lots of small neighborhood cafes and stores where you can buy the necessities. Just don't expect 4-star anything and you'll be just fine. Maybe they're better off advertising themselves as a good budget alternative to more spendy 3-star choices closer to the Sol and Opera areas. I think many reviewers here got a bit hung up on how they advertise themselves as a 4-star property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast and overall stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and found everything ok with this hotel as always. Our only criticism is that the maid could have vacuumed our room during our stay and changed our sheets. We have stayed before and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need is in easy reach.”
Reviews.Author: 4tripcrit7
Reviews.Content: If you are a party animal and looking to step out of your hotel into the raging nightlife then please don't stay here. BUT if you love big fluffy towels, transport to the heart of the city at your doorstep, food markets and family run restaurants just across the street then look no further than the Hotel Praga. The staff are willing to help but please remember that they speak Spanish. If you can't then it is not their fault. Breakfast was very wholesome. The rooms were clean and plenty big enough. A great place to stay and one to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: gogo65
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs an update the rooms are very old. bathrooms are quite large and clean. Was here as part of a Cosmos tour but booked extra nights by myself and had dinner breakfast and free wifi included, excellent value. This hotel is not in the centre of Madrid, I knew that when I booked, but transport is excellent with the bus stop out the front and the metro about a 10 minute walk away. Breakfast was OK. All in all not bad value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Cheiranthus
Reviews.Content: Am staying at this hotel now and very much enjoying it. The room is clean and of a very good size and the bathroom, linens and towels very nice! Only drawback is that my room is at the front of the hotel and it is noisy from the street, but I brought ear plugs so no problem sleeping whatsoever. A friend has a room at the back which is very quiet though. The breakfast buffet is large and comprehensive, and their orange juice v. good. Staff at the desk are friendly and helpful, although their English was perhaps not as good as it might have been. The location as far as transport is concerned suited us very well. The bus stop right outside the hotel is for no 23 which goes to La Latina and Plaza Mayor, and the underground at Marques de Vadillo is about 10 minutes walk. Three nice places for food nearby: Los Cigarrales (expensive), Ovido (very nice and modern) and Taverna Dominguez (traditional bar/restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “Only stay if you do not have another option”
Reviews.Author: Karlla A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the suburb with no facilities. It is far from the downtown. It doesn't deserve a 4 star rating. They don't have wifi in the bedrooms. Not a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, good value.”
Reviews.Author: abc123Victoria
Reviews.Content: Quite good value for money. Area definitely not the swish part of town but felt fine walking around at night and local tapas bars great (Dominiques is esp good with English and Spanish menus, and very nice staff). Hotel breakfast was Ok but dinner (on Cosmos tour) was not at all to our liking-prefer tapas bars! Catch bus 23 (1 euro) to the Plaza Mayor. Walk from there to visit the 'Royal palace(9am/early'/to avoid crowds). Walk other way to the lovely 'Relais' Park and see this beautiful part of town!

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: betsyhal
Reviews.Content: I don't believe this should qualify as a 4-star. The price was right for a triple room. The hotel was far from tourist sights, but you are much closer to middle class Spaniards and regular stores. Prices were much cheaper for clothes and food in this part of town. We took advantage of the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay.”
Reviews.Author: BaileyBird
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight in order to drive down to Tarifa the next day. We had a bit of trouble finding the place, but once we did the staff was very nice and helpful. Nothing extra special, but it was a decent hotel, especially for the price. It is NOT close to the airport if that is what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “lame”
Reviews.Author: DjsTrip
Reviews.Content: Lobby looked ok, but the rooms didn't match. Wifi cost 4 euro per day, which isn't a lot of money, but every other room I booked in Spain had free wifi. Even crappy little hostals have free wifi. Location isn't great, although bus 23 is directly outside. I prefer to travel by metro, which is father away. I would prefer to be much closer to the center of town. Overall a sub-par experience.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly073
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience we have ever had! The walls were so thin you could hear people cough in the next room - the street noise was terrible, but the worst thing was the cigarette smoke that came through the air vents! We could not sleep the smoke and noise were so awful. We called the management, and they were not helpful. The price was cheap, but still not worth the stench and discomfort caused by other noisy guests. This hotel should not be considered by anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service-Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Turist12
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel Praga knowing fully well that not all reviews on it were favorable. At first, I was pleasantly surprised as the amenities seemed to be acceptable by anyone's standards. The hotel is not conveniently located from the airport, and one needs to change metro 3 times in order to get there. Unless you plan to take a taxi to the airport, I would not recommend this location. Throughout our stay, we discovered that customer service was severely lacking at this hotel. We pre-paid for breakfast for example, but because we arrived a bit later then when the breakfast was served, the hotel refused to accomodate a meal. On our last night, we asked for a picnic breakfast to go since our plane was early in the morning and again were denied. Keep in mind, we pre-paid for breakfast for the duration of our stay. Although I could still understand them not accomodating our breakfast, the way that the did it was not acceptable. The front desk would refer us to the head waiter, who did not speak English, and who in turn would bring us back to the front desk. At that time, the front desk attendant would just tell us that, no, the meal will not be covered. Why send us all over the hotel? The worst hovewer happened on the day we were supposed to depart. The hotel forgot to give us a wake up call in the morning and we overslept, missing our plane to Barcelona as a result. When we woke up, 1.5 hours later then planned, my husband called downstairs and requested for hotel to pay for the taxi, since it was there fault. They said, OK, no problem, just come downstairs. When we ran downstairs and came to the front desk to get the taxi voucher, they pretended that they don't even know anything about our wake up call, or the call from the room only minutes before. In all my years of travel, I have never seen such customer service! Bottom line, the gate was closed when we got to the airport and we had to purchase new tickets. $325 that we never were able to recoup! Stay here at your own risk, but I would not recommend it to my frieds Forgot to ad, it was difficult to sleep at night due to the super thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel Right in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers123
Reviews.Content: Hotel Praga was located in Madrid Spain at Antonio Lopez 65. I stayed at this hotel as part of a tour of Madrid with Contiki in 2007. On arrival it looked like a good place to stay as the lobby was nice and big and classy. The room I stayed in was fit for a king, it was really clean and lots of space to move around in. The water in the sink and shower was clean and had lots of good hot water. As well, the toilet flushed very well at every attempt, very good. The room was a journey from elevator to my room, as it was almost like a maze in that hallway. Overall it was still a nice and quiet room. The banquet room where we ate dinner was totally awesome, it was an all you can eat buffet with everything you could imagine and expect in a buffet. The location of the hotel was good. The hotel is located in a local commercial area, with plenty of local shops surrounding it. There was a supermarket a couple of doors away, and plenty of local restaurants very close by. Take a number 23 bus outside the front door for 1 euro to get into the Plaza Mayo in about 15 - 20 minutes. It was a nice hotel overall, I would stay here again and recommend travbuddies to stay here as well. If you plan on coming here, let me know and we could compare notes. Thank you for reading this review.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & clean rooms, but sound proofing issues.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious, spottlessly clean & comfortable. Great selection for breakfast. Wi-fi costs a reasonable 4 euro for 24hr period. The location, which is about a 10 minute walk from the nearest metro station (Marques de Vadillo), which itself is a 10 minute ride to the centre of Madrid, this was not an issue for me, as i wanted to stay away from the noise of the centre. However, the major drawback with this hotel is the walls are paper thin, i could hear people in rooms across the corridor, the lifts etc. Such a shame, as otherwise, this was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: klimt01
Reviews.Content: Hotel Praga is a good hotel, I'm not quite sure why it's gotten so many negative reviews on here! For the price it is certainly worth it; it has everything you would hope for. It was very clean, the room was spacious enough (we stayed in a triple room), and we had no problems with noise. I'm also not sure why the staff have been called rude by so many people - we had absolutely no problems with the staff at all. We had to call ahead as our plane was delayed and we were going to be arriving late at the hotel. The receptionist spoke English and was quite friendly over the phone, and when we arrived they were very nice, and our check in took under 5 minutes. They were polite and friendly for the duration of our stay and were willing to help us out with anything we needed. This hotel is not central, however the bus stop at the front of the hotel is very convenient, and we found it no problem to commute to the centre every day. It was about a 5 minute bus trip and was cheap too. One night we caught a taxi back from the centre and that didn't cost us much at all. At first the area (Antonio Lopez) didn't seem particularly safe, however we had no problems walking around the streets by ourselves at night time, and we are 3 females in our twenties. Overall I was happy with our stay at the Hotel Praga and would recommend it to someone staying in Madrid who doesn't mind being a little while away from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: gphillipsii
Reviews.Content: For what we paid for this hotel for New Year's Eve, we were impressed with the quality. It was a much nicer hotel than most I've stayed in in Europe. The rooms were clean and spacious. While the hotel wasn't close to downtown, the metro was only a 10 minute walk away, and the bus out front went directly to Plaza Mayor.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom_87005
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for about a week and I was not impressed with it at all. This was by far the worst hotel we stayed at in our 4 week stay in Europe. Staff seemed to be plentiful but noone appeared to be doing anything, the reception staff were amazingly unhelpful. The food for buffet dinner and breakfast was inedible, with copious amounts of oil, nothing was fresh, we actually got sick from the food one of the nights. It is poorly located, about a 10 minute walk to the metro. It's similar to staying in a suburban neighbourhood not in a city. The rooms were small and it seemed we had to pay for anything good to watch on tv, there are no included movie channels like most of the other hotels we stayed at. Wifi is amazingly expensive at 4 Euro for an hour, most of the other hotels Wifi was free. Fair to say we were thoroughly disappointed with this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel of all my travels”
Reviews.Author: buddy2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel Praga, Madrid, claims to be a 4 star hotel. This is far from the case. From the beginning of our stay we were constantly unimpressed with hotel services. Checking in alone took over 20 mins. Only one staff member was checking people in while three others stood around doing what appeared to be nothing. Furthermore, staff on many ocassions were unhelpful and none of them seemed to want to be there. The buffet breakfast is a joke. Cold eggs, warm yoghurt and cold coffee was on the menu. Far from a 4 star breakfast. Also internet access is expensive at 4 Euro for an hour. Until Hotel Praga I have never stayed in a 4 star hotel where you pay for wifi access. Lastly, the location is terrible. Far away from town. The only saving grace was the metro - which is a good 10-15 min walk away. Overall I would never reccommend this hotel and would give it a 1 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in all my travels”
Reviews.Author: stubby9417
Reviews.Content: Been traveling for a long time to over 15 different countries. This hotel was the worst in all my experiences. The staff seem to hate and detest all their guests. It seems to be a system wide problem as anybody at the front desk is insanely rude, even at check in or check out. The rooms are a joke. The quality of the rooms are about a 2 star, rather than the suggested 4 stars. Don't expect to sleep. The walls don't exist. The location of the hotel is not convenient for tourists. You are put in a residential neighborhood that is a 15 min walk to the metro. You can take the bus to Plaza mayor, but how many times are you going to be going there? The only value to staying here is b/c it is cheap. But we found a far better hotel for about the same part in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “good noisy deal.....”
Reviews.Author: DelBueno
Reviews.Content: Pricing and location are great for this hotel. There is a bus stop for bus route 23 right outside of the hotel that will take you to the Plaza Mayor and there is another station on the other side of freeway M30 for bus route 55 which takes you to Atocha station where you can take the trains or walk to the museums. The facilities are clean, quite acceptable. My only complaint is that like many hotels in Spain the whole hotel is like a sound box and you can hear noise from your neighbors and this is specially true in the mornings and late nights. During my stay a group of school students was staying in and I had to go down to the lobby to complain on a daily basis at 12:30 and later in the night. Why would the hotel place youngters in any other level but the first level is beyond me but to the hotel's credit they did go up and had the kids remain quiet. On the down side also, the internet access is expensive at four euros per hour and I typically lost almost 10 minutes in rebooting one of the two laptops located in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, friendly staff, excellent condition”
Reviews.Author: ih_e99y
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Praga is roughly 25-30 minutes from the airport and a taxi costs around €25-30. Hotel Staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is not in the the centre, but the centre is very easy to get to via the underground.. 3day underground pass cost for €11, and you can travel the whole of madrid.

Reviews.Title: “The price is great”
Reviews.Author: swizzleman
Reviews.Content: It's not in the heart of Madrid, but there's a bus outside the door that will get you to Plaza Santa Ana in ten minutes. Great value. The neighbourhood is fun to explore as well. Some good local cafes and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: scotspinklady
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 day trip in Madrid with my boyfriend! I chose this hotel by reading all the reviews on tripadvisor and thought this was the best choice! I was very happy with my decision! At first when we arrived i was a little worried as the area isnt really that fantastic, but the hotel was good! We got checked in very easily and the staff spoke English and had us checked in very quickly! The rooms are very clean and the bathrooms are lovely. I am quite picky when it comes to hotels being clean and i was very impressed! Unfortunately i had my bag stolen in the centre of Madrid in Sol on the the 3rd day of my trip and the staff at the hotel were very helpfull and phoned the police for me and let me use the hotel reception phone. There was previous reviews regarding the staff but i honestly cannot fault them as they were very helpful when i was quite upset about getting my bag stolen! The area of the hotel isnt really that exciting, we found there really wasnt much to do but there is a bus stop directly outside the front door and you can take the number 23 to the plaza mayor for 1 euro which is very reasonable, the tube is a very short walk to the top of the street, i have never used the tube before and found it very easy and safe to use! Overall i would def use this hotel again, the service i received was very good, unfortunately i dont think i will rush back to Madrid again anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Aguilas
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Praga is roughly 25-30 minutes from the airport and a taxi costs around €35-40 depending on time of day. We stayed at this hotel at both the beginning and end of our holiday which was a tour of Spain, Portugal and Morocco with Archers Direct although we made our own way to and from the hotel as we flew from Tenerife to Madrid rather than one of the UK airports. We arrived at around 9.00pm and checked in easily. The reception staff who spoke excellent English told us to leave our cases and go straight to the dining room where the welcome meeting had just finished and a meal was being served. The buffet style meal was excellent and included a free bottle of wine. On arrival in our room we found our cases had been delivered and the room was spotlessly clean, had good air con and considering the amount of traffic outside was very quiet. The bathroom was nice and the toiletry products were good quality. TV with 4 English channels, mini-bar and in room safe were all included together with either smoking or non-smoking rooms so something to suit everyone. After a good night’s sleep and a first-rate breakfast we received a map of the city from Reception and were directed to the No. 23 bus which stops right outside the hotel and which for €1 takes you to the centre (Plaza Mayor) where along with the tourist attractions you can find many shops bars and restaurants. The bus runs every 10 minutes throughout the day until midnight but if you don´t want to do the 10 minute journey there are plenty of places to eat or get a drink, together with supermarkets along the same road as the hotel. Although it is a busy area with lots of traffic and people the neighbourhood feels safe and for being almost city centre is for the most part clean. Overall - The staff were always available and professional, and service, cleanliness and comfort was either good or excellent. Wi-Fi centre situated in the foyer was reasonably priced and 4 fast lifts were a bonus. Talking to the 36 other travellers on our tour everyone had only good things to say about this hotel – which wasn´t the case with some we stayed in !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, easy access, quieter than the center of town”
Reviews.Author: DLeshus
Reviews.Content: My experience was very nice. Room was air conditioned, nicely furnished, reasonably quiet, and clean. Bathroom was fabulous. Desk staff spoke English and is as helpful as requested. The Metro is only a few minutes' walk away (a bit of construction going on now, but traversing is easy). I took the Metro to and from the airport, and if you're willing to do the little bit of advance planning required, buying a pass at the airport and making a transfer or two is a real bargain. Then you can use your pass the remainder of your trip for Metro and the bus...my three days of pass cost less than half of one taxi ride to the airport. For this hotel, the real transportation key is the bus line right outside the front door. Ten minutes and you're in the center of town. It's located in a fun suburban neighborhood with stores, markets, and lots of bars/restaurants close by with a far less touristy feel than in the center.. Not to mention more than a little quieter at night. ..the people in Madrid love their nightlife! In the neighborhood places around the hotel, try some Spanish and you'll often get some English attempted back in return. And isn't that part of what makes travel so much fun? One note: if you ask for a key for your room safe, don't be put off by the amount asked for--most is deposit which you get back at checkout (not made clear when you ask). Like a lot of European hotels, sound-deadening between rooms isn't a priority, but this wasn't an issue for me. I'd gladly stay there again--a great home base for exploring Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Value. Want more tourist central Area-May want Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: MJ72508
Reviews.Content: After the reviews I read I thought it would be fine for my fiance and I. Let's be honest mixed reviews are usually successful for people more concerned about the trip than the hotel. This is exactly what we found. The hotel was perfect for what we needed, the rooms were clean and the staff was great. They all spoke English fluently (if that was a concern for some) and offered good recommendations- if you asked. If you are looking for a lively area near your hotel you may want to opt out of this one. It is more of a local area (see pics). The hours of shops and restaurants are open but are limited because it doesn't cater to tourist schedules as places in the center did. Overall, it is great for a younger couple or people willing to do the trip on a bargain. The area doesn't seem the safest for people not used to "suburban areas" of Europe. Tip 1: Buy breakfast or snacks for a day in the center in this area because the prices are much more affordable. Tip 2: Buy a metro pass for the trip. We took the train to the hotel from the airport (much cheaper than the cab we had to take back!). The bus schedule, though great did not go to the areas we were also interested in so you need to take the metro anyway once you get off the bus. Tip 3: As mentioned by others, Plaza Mayor is a must to check out and has good night life and the bus will take you right there and you literally walk out the hotel doors to the stop. There is a night bus which runs after the metro and other buses, in case you stay out after midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Kriss
Reviews.Content: we have used this hotel twice now and would definitely use it again. A few minutes walk from the metro. A bus stops outside front doors and travels to centre of the city. Good tapas bars and restaurants on the same street. I do wonder at some of the reviewers here who criticise staff not being able to speak English - why should they? This is Spain! We don't speak Spanish but can usually pick up a couple of words to be polite (please and thank you being the most important) and we have never gone hungry or thirsty. Very good value - last time we had a very very good last minute deal.

Reviews.Title: “Better than reviews suggest!!”
Reviews.Author: Doddsy71
Reviews.Content: The night before I arrived I was reading some reviews and was not looking forward to the trip at all, once we arrived at the hotel (a 40 Euro taxi from the airport) it was almost midnight, the entrance was clean and quiet. We were checked in easily but the hotel does not provide maps of local attractions but the staff were very good although a bit short when speaking to you. The 26 bus stop is right outside the front door and for 1 euro takes a 10 min trip to Plaza Mayor and all attraction surrounding. Rooms were clean, air conditioning worked and is free!!

Reviews.Title: “Classic European hotel for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: MDDad
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, I was hesitant to stay at the Hotel Praga, but I had no say since I was a guest at a meeting being held at the hotel. While lacking luxury, it ended up being better than expected. Many of the problems discussed in prior reviews have been addressed. The service was better than expected, and they went out of their way to assist my wife and child while I was in my meetings. They have added wireless internet throughout the hotel for 6 Euros per day, and the conference facility was above average including a booth that could be used for simultaneous language translation. The Hotel Praga is located 25-30 minutes from the airport, and a taxi from the airport will cost approximately 30 Euros. It is approximately a 10 minute walk from the Metro, and all of the tourist sites can be reached within 20-25 minutes including the walk. There are quite a few restaurants and cafes within walking distance from the hotel. Americans who are not used to European hotels may want to look elsewhere, however. The rooms are fairly small, and they are not air-conditioned. Many of the staff speak limited English. The hotel is located in a more commercial part of Madrid, and it can be noisy at night especially when the windows are kept open due to the lack of air conditioning. The rooms lack many of the luxuries found in many hotels including alarm clocks, hair dryers, coffee pots, and a fitness center. For those on a budget who care most about cleanliness and location, this may be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: K2daJ
Reviews.Content: I have just came back from a long weekend staying at the Hotel Praga with my friends. We arrived late on Friday evening and were welcome by a receptionist speaking good english. Our room, was spotless although the air-con did not properly work. There is a great bus service from the bus stop outside the hotel on the number 23 which takes you to Plaza Major in 20 mins. I would definitely reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here...”
Reviews.Author: StephenBrowne
Reviews.Content: ... if you are expecting 4 stars - this is far from that. On the basis of it being a lasminute.com recommendation (special, first on the list of Madrid searched hotels) I booked it for 4 nights, the first being my wife's birthday. Upon arrival at the nearest Metro staion you walk down a very seedy street to find this nonedescript building that certainly does not set the heart apace. Arrival at reception was also a lacklustre affair - see previous rating (same day) by someone else for how that goes, but then the icing on the cake - a very sub-standard room overlooking the veritible slums across the road. This is a 2.5 star at the most. Do not deceive yourself or let the hotels own ratings fool you. This is NOT a 4 star hotel. We immediately tried to contact lasminute.com but after being on hold for 50 minutes (yes from abroad) and no answer went around the corner to an Internet Cafe and found a 3 star hotel elsewhere (far superior to this hotel, closer and better located to the centre, in a much nicer area, very friendly and helpful staff) and left straight away. Because we did not give 24 hours notice we were charged 1 night when we did not stay at the hotel at all. How could we give 24 hours notice when we had not seen what a dump the place? We did not soil the bathrooom, disturb the bedsheets or use anything in the room - because we thought we would not be staying - but still the manager was adamant and charged 1 night. That gives the flavour of the type of character of the hotel and the management style. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But Most Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: LShero
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this hotel in January. The location is ideal, just a short journey to the city centre by bus (bus stop right outside and service very frequent. Also a 10 min walk to the metro station). The hotel itself was nice, clean and comfortable. However, the staff were really unfriendly and gave the impression they did not want any guests in the hotel! We found this attitude unbeliebable. Even when we simply asked the staff behind reception for directions to the nearest metro station they were not overly helpful. Because of this attitude we would never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid-Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: WelcimStranger
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in November 2008 in this hotl, which was the starting and finishing point for a Cosmos bus tour that was booked by this tour company. The hotel is located in a local commercial area, with plenty of local shops surrounding it. There was a supermarket a couple of doors away, and plenty of local restaurants very close by. Take a number 23 bus outside the front door for 1 euro to get into the Plaza Mayo in about 15 - 20 minutes. The hotel provided a good buffet breakfast and we found the room clean and very comfortable, there wasn't a view out of our window, just local residential buildings. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonnaBA
Reviews.Content: We booked a hotel room for three people. It had 2 comfortable twin beds with a small sofa bed for the 3rd person. The room was small for hotel standards, but it was still roomy and sufficient for three adults. The closet space was pretty spacious. The room was clean and the bathroom was "fancy" with granite-like walls and countertop. It was kind of small though. The hotel room and comforts are fine, however, the location is a bit of a distance from the metro/subway. It's about a 10 minute walk, but there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel. The pros about the walk from the subway to hotel are ample cafes/restaurants and shopping stores along the way and a bakery close by. The people at the front desk aren't very welcoming, however the room maid did a wonderful job keeping our room clean. The taxi is at the front of the hotel 24/7 whenever you need it, so no need to call and reserve. I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel, even though the room was clean and comfortable. It's just a little too far from a subway (even though there's a bus stop in front of hotel).

Reviews.Title: “what a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: red kop
Reviews.Content: just stayed 2 nights at the praga,was very impressed,room was excellent,with a smashing marble bathroom,great bar,was there to see liverpool play athletico madrid,the praga is about a 5 minute walk to the vincente calderon stadium,a bit longer if you stop at all the tapas bars along the way,thought the area round the hotel was good + all the people very friendly,if we happen to go to madrid in the new year,maybe against real,would seriously consider staying at the praga again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: haidukka
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week -end at the Praga Hotel. The hotel was great, very clean and good services. The hotel is not in the center, but the bus station was in front of the hotel and it leads you near the Plaza Mayor. You can reach down town in 10 minutes. Also, in the evening you can serve dinner at the restaurants near the hotel, with low budget The double rooms and the triple rooms are large, they cleaned the room every day. As we were a group, the staff was very kind, and they helped us to rent a van to the airport. I recomand this hotel for low cost trips and also good price- quality services. Kind regards

Reviews.Title: “Praga in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: samartin26
Reviews.Content: Our room #829 had views overlooking high-rise residential blocks, but I didnt expect stunning views when booking a stay in Madrid. This hotel is a little way out of the centre, but we were happy to use the metro system. The staff were good and breakfast was satisfactory. All in all, as a base in a capital city it was all that we could have expected for the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: KittyDenmark
Reviews.Content: Please do your self a favour and stay away from this hotel. I'd like to tell you about my horrible experience when I stayed there for 3 nights from July 10th till July 13th; I wanted to iron my dress and when I pluged my iron in the plug I got electricuted and burned my hand and ruined my iron!!
