I immediatly rang the reception and as it turned out, the receptionists were completely oblivious to what had happened and when I asked for someone to come up to my room to see what had happened, I was told that there was nothing they could do and if I had a problem I should come down to the reception. After this they hung up on me and then refused to answer when I called back!! Of course it later turned out that their plugs were completely dreadful ( imagine if one pluged his valuable computer in to the plug, only to have it burned and ruined!!) Upon leaving, one of the receptionists even called us names in front of other guests!! Please do not have your stay in Madrid ruined by going there, the service is absolutely abhor, their knowledge of English likewise and furthermore I think it is completely ridiculous that this hotel has been granted 4 stars when their cleaning is poor and the don't even have a computer room!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Laurabelle68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Praga for 3 nights and it must be the noisiest hotel we have stayed in! The walls are so thin that we could hear the couple chatting in the next room and snoring during the night! It's a very busy tourist hotel with coach loads arriving all the time (2 am on our last night). Other residents had little respect that others may be sleeping and there was lots of door banging and loud talking in the corridors. This also happened in the mornings, as early as 6 am, as coach loads checked out. The cleaning staff would start around 8.30 am and would also talk very louldly and at times shout to each other along the corridors. Not good when we were unable to get to sleep until 2 am and then were woken again at 6 am! You could also hear the people in rooms above, particularly when they were using their bathroom. We found the reception staff unfriendly and therefore didn't approach them again after our enquiry on our first night. On a positive note, the rooms were a decent size and clean and the No 23 bus stop is right outside, which is really handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: rrobstet
Reviews.Content: For price paid great room, room was clean and modern only issue I had was that it was not centrally located and was quite a walk to the metro station. Great resteraunts nearby

Reviews.Title: “Praga not that bad”
Reviews.Author: AguilanTravellers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a residencial area which was a mixed area of shops and cafes and a few nice restuarants.the area seeed safe and was always clean and well maintained. The hotel is located about a five min walk from the metro so you don't need a cab. The hotel is a basicly furnished and the staff are not overly friendly, rooms are small and ours was a bit dark as we had an internal room overlooking a central courtyard this was a good thing as it was a quite room which ment we could keep the windows open all night as the heating in the rooms is Very Very Hot and the controls in the room had no effect on the heat. on a whole the hotel is clean and functional as long as the rate you pay is right its a good base for a trip to Madrid Food in the hotel is expensive and not really good value for breakfast try a visit to the cafeteria Orgaz about 3 mins down the road in the direction on of the metro excellent staff and service at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Flaws”
Reviews.Author: jayrah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Praga Hotel for 4 Nights in April. Room could have been cleaner and was very small with even smaller TV that wasnt working and a view to the parking area. There was a balcony what was nice but also heading the parking area. Staff wasn`t terribly friendly but it was ok. Never used Room Service or Restaurant in Hotel. We had no complaints about Location. There were some things worth visiting in walking distance and it was near the highway. Big Supermarket nearby but it was hard to find some good dining without using the car.

Reviews.Title: “room broken into”
Reviews.Author: mollyamber
Reviews.Content: Im writing this review with huge delay as i was so disappointed with the hotel and my stay. I stayed in feb 2007 for 3 nights with a friend. The hotel itself was fine, but on our last full day we went sight seeing and upon returning to the hotel found that our room had been broken into and my mp3 player, watch, jewellery and £150 had been stolen. The management did not care in the slightest and i spent my last day at the local police station, which was a nightmare as no-one in madrid seems to speak any english! The hotel manager seemed to think we were to blame by leaving the door open! which was impossible as the doors are heavy duty fire doors with key card locks. In summary, do not go there unless you wish all your personal belongings to get stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: travellady83
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Praga at the beginning and the end of a bus tour of Spain, Portugal, and Morocco, so we had no choice in selecting the hotel. We were to stay at another hotel, but the tour company made the switch at the last moment, just before we left the states. Boy, were we disappointed. The other hotel looked much nicer. During the course of our time at the Praga, we were scolded by the staff for taking a packaged cake out of the breakfast room; we witnessed a theft in the hotel lobby while another tour group was getting their room assignments; we were without hot water on our last check-out day and had to leave for the airport without a shower; and we were told there was no breakfast bag to take along to the airport for our early flight, even though one was promised by the tour company. The neighborhood is run down. A homeless man sleeps two doors down from the hotel next to the grocery store. The sidewalks are littered with dog poop and the tapas bars are very smokey. The Pizza Hut across the street (the only option for food at one point) had very rude personnel who overcharged us and served lousy food. I walked down the street and gave mine to the homeless man because one look at it told me I couldn't eat it. The previous bad reviews about breakfast are all too true. Watch your belongings. We were told that the locals in the area watch for the bus tours to arrive and then they stroll into the hotel and look for something to steal. Pay more and stay elsewhere, if you have a choice. We didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: serortlop
Reviews.Content: Merely , It is the best hotel that I have ever been. Recently renewed, fantastic location in order to later on travel to Toledo, Escorial or Andalucia. Closest to the main highways. 15 Min from the Center of the city by bus... .The staff is very friendly and it's not expensive giving the quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EireannIrl
Reviews.Content: Breakfast at this hotel is awful. Very cheap horrible tasting so called orange juice, foul tea and a poor selection of fresh fruit, and cheap tasting yoghurt.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel despite Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: tim_m
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was pleasantly surprised. It is a smart, clean 4 star hotel with renovation work going on in the foyer (the lift buttons are still sellotaped on!) while the rooms are very comfortable, clean and sound-proofed from the main road. The only difficulties were that the staff spoke little English (you could regard them as rude, but we felt it was more a communication issue), while the hotel is way out of the centre and access to the sights takes a real effort by bus, metro or taxi. Still, this is NOT a bad hotel by any definition of the term.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Hotel Praga...............”
Reviews.Author: MimiDublin
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I was in Madrid with one of friends at the beginning of June and was really looking forward to the trip. Firstly the hotel is NOTHIN like it is on the internet. It's a hell of alot worse, tiny rooms...........very dated. Staff leave a lot to be desired very rude. Men at work while I was there ladders, you name it...........they charge for everything Breakfast was €10.00 and awful..........don't even go there. I would give this hotel 2 out of ten and that is for the bus that stops right outside it and brings you to Plaza Mayor.............

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaD
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, I thought it was close to the Atocha metro stop. It is not! However, it is halfway between two metro lines, the Marques de Vadilla on Line #5 and Usera on Line #6. It is a short walk to both of these, and we were able to navigate the city easily with the location. We were really impressed with Hotel Praga, especially considering the cheap rates. The bathroom was wonderful, and the room was nicer than a much more expensive hotel we stayed at in Madrid earlier in the week. The staff were also very friendly, and we had a great experience. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “please please stay away”
Reviews.Author: DublinBilko
Reviews.Content: this has got to be the worst hotel i have ever had the misfortune of staying in. the front staff need serious training on how to deal with customers. the hotel porters are not much better, dont know how it ever got a 4star rating its a bad 2star would never go back even if given a free night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Much A Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travelxx
Reviews.Content: We visited Madrid in late Feb 07 and stayed in Hotel Praga during our visit there. The following are the good things about the hoteI/area: a) relatively in-expensive when booked on-line [we paid 180EUR for 3 nights - no breakfast]. That's inexpensive in comparison to hotel prices in Ireland! b) room was good size and contained everything [even very expensive mini bar]. c) hotel was very clean as was the room d)some good tapas bars in the area. Not so good things: a) not located in central Madrid [where sights and shopping is]. However, it is only a small walk to the nearest Metro station and central Madrid is only about 5 stops away. b) area hotel is in is a little run down c) hotel is situated on busy main road - look for room to the back of hotel as Madrid never sleeps and the noise pollution may keep you awake! d) communication problems! Only the staff on front desk spoke English. Was a nightmare trying to get a drink in the bar - the barman did not understand a single word I said! e) staff quite rude - front desk were helpful - but certainly did not go out of their way. f) tv only had BBC news! g) advertised tea/coffee making facilities in room but this did not exist. It is very much a business hotel ... We didn't eat in the hotel as there are great places in central madrid to eat. You should try a place called "RIBS" - does Texan food. Was really good! It was a very enjoyable trip to Madrid. Would certainly suggest it as a city to visit. The hotel was okay for what we paid but next time I would book a hotel closer to central Madrid as the Metro service ends at 1am and this is just when the fun is beginning. Enjoy your trip .... :)

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure”
Reviews.Author: clarej
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here i was pretty worried but looking forward to the bathroom! After an hour drive with the cab going the wrong way we eventually got to the hotel. It looked in very good shape, almost New York-y..... Check in was ok, although a few members of staff just walked past us instead of helping. When we got checked in we went up to our room in the lift (there are 3), it was absolutely tiny!! You could only fit 2 people and a small suitcase in there! If you had more than that you would have to send you luggage in seperate lifts! We were quite surprised with the size of the room, being from England we know what the rooms are normally like! After all the good reveiews on here about the bathroom i felt pretty let down, it was just a bog standard bathroom. The hotel was pretty well located i think. It was only a few stops on the metro to Sol and Gran Via where there are great shops! At only €1 per metro ride you cant complain. We also had a few drinks in the bar, they are quite expensive as you would expect from a hotel but they have never ending measures of alcohol. They only stop pouring when you shout at them! If you think you can handle the constant beeping from the cars, then ask for a room at the front of the hotel. Its great to just watch life go by. The curtains dont fit the windows properly and the windows dont seem to be double glazed as you can always hear the constant buzz of traffic. All in all, i think this hotel is pretty good value for money and would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ccfromnyc
Reviews.Content: Hope this helps for anyone looking since I got alot from the reviews I read here: Stayed at Hotel Praga for 3 nights during a trip to Madrid/Barcelona had a great time. Didn't get any attitude from front desk as mentioned in other reviews, room was adequately furnished, clean, and bathroom had great water pressure (refreshing after an 8 hour flight). There is also a security guard at the door at nights. No problems feeling safe, only once did I see people loitering around late into the morning, but no different from HS kids in the states hanging out at the corner. Paid $75/nt from Cheaptickets. Asked for a quiet room on a high floor and got it., although it faced the back of the street where there are apt buildings. Location was very convenient, we didnt want to be in the center but have easy access to it. There is a bus stop right in front (#23) that takes you to Plaza Mayor and back. There is also a Metro stop 10 mins away. I prefer the metros (very clean and efficient) since its easier to get anywhere in the city. 10 trips cards are 6.15 Euros, we bought a couple and saw the entire city. If you're not travelling with a ton of bags, save $35-40 Euro by taking the train. Take the shuttle bus to terminal 2, where you can get the 8 Line, transfer at Colombia to the 9 and at Nunez Balboa to the 5. Get off at Marques de Vadilla stop. Antonio Lopez is right off to the side when you come out of the station and its about 10 mins walk to the hotel. As for places to go, Plaza Mayor, Plaza Sol, Museo Prado, Real, Retiro Park are all easily accessible by transport. Prado is free on Sundays and Retiro is great for spending a day just sitting around. There is also a alot of shopping along Gran Via and Sol. Ham is their specialty and tapas bars are plentiful. Also try the churros with hot chocolate. We also ran into a red light area but can't remember where that was. I found people in Spain to be very nice and helpful. My small grasp of Spanish went along. Some speak English also, just dont expect everyone to be bilingual.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid is great, but this hotel [----]!”
Reviews.Author: Ulrike48&daughter
Reviews.Content: What can I say. The people at the front desk were extremely unhelpful. When I said I was in a hurry to check-in because the car was in front of the hotel and needed to be properly parked, the receptionist just smiled like the devil and surely did not hurry. When I asked him to explain again where the garage was he said, "I already told you so!" The hotel room itself was very loud since the ventilation was broken and the window had to be opened at night. My complaint about the broken ventilation was ignored. The hotel is not advertised correctly. It is not close to downtown like their website shows. It is not a four star hotel no matter how you would rate it. The staff are very arrogant and overall unhelpful. It seemed they gave out incorrect information about buses and transportation on purpose. Madrid is great, but save yourself a headache and stay at a real hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not very convenient to anything”
Reviews.Author: jrdz0214
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were fine, but the hotel was not close to anything, so you will have to take the metro or taxi to see much. We found it to be more enjoyable on a previous stay to be closer to the Plaza Mayor area. We got a little annoyed when we asked at the front desk for them to call a cab for us when we had reservations for dinner and we were told to just go stand out at the taxi stop on the corner and wait. Taxis do not like to stop in this part of town, so after waiting for 20 minutes, we had to go back inside and request again. We got finally got some reluctant help.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Karendude
Reviews.Content: This was the starting point of our Cosmos tour. I thought by arriving a day early we would miss some of the bus tour crowd. Wrong. Hotel Praga has one tour company after another, and the front lobby can feel like Grand Central Station. I asked for a room in front with a balcony, he said nothing and handed me the key. Sure enough, it was the back of the hotel. That is the best example of the type of service you get at the front desk. In relation to the other places we stayed at: Beds better than average. Excellent water pressure in shower. More English TV stations, and movies. Breakfast buffet poor. (scambled egg soup, canned fruit) Easy access to bus, shops. Rooms average, clean. There was NO english spoken at the Pizza Hut, nor the Burger King which are a short walk away. Even getting a whopper with cheese turned out to be a challenge. Just a few doors to the right, there is a SMALL (counter seating ony) place, La Parada. The owner Salvator, spoke english and did everything possible to make us feel welcome. My husband and myself felt safe. There were elderly ladies out walking their dogs. However I would still be on guard in a commercial area like that. Directly to the left is a grocery store. In front, up the hill to the left there is a tobacco shop that sells stamps. There is major construction that you can hear. They are moving a major expressway undergound. Depending on the price I may or may not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kittyphobia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Madrid for 2 days and stayed at Hotel Praga. I thought that this was a good base to explore madrid from. There is a bus stop conveniently right outside the hotel which takes you to the centre (Plaza Mayor) in 15 minutes. Otherwise, you can walk for 5-10 minutes and there is a metro station which you can also take. The rooms inside were clean and comfortable, the shower was very good, we have been travelling around for a week and stayed in other places, this hotel had the best shower out of all the places that we stayed at! I think for the price we paid, this hotel was excellent value, good location and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “average, adequate, great bathroom”
Reviews.Author: RuthRussell
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was nice and smart with shiny marble (at least it looked fairly real-ish) floors. The staff were not rude, as we had expected, they were actually quite pleasant and spoke good english. We took our own bags up to our room and were very happy when we discovered the bathroom - smart marble floors and walls, a bath, shower, bidet, toilet, and nice big sink. The bedroom, however, was rather dull. The decor was very boring, basic, and didn't feel very homely. The view out the window was not great. We had a clear view of the block of flats and the wall opposite. This was out the back of the hotel. There were no net curtains so we were in full view of all the people living in the flats opposite. The beds were, as per most double hotel rooms in the continent, two single beds side by side. this is ok sometimes but one of them was wobbly and a bit squeeky and we ended up trying to share one - a bit squished! One big bonus, however, was the very effective full length blackout curtains. I liked these very much. i also think they helped block out a bit of the noise from the motorway still under construction as they were so heavy. Also, for a quiet night in if that is your sort of thing there was sky news, cnn and BBC world for free on the tv and several pay per view movie channels in english. You could get access to all the 'in-room cinema' channels for about 12 euros for up to 24 hours. Breakfast was not included in the price of the expedia booking. this was a big pity. The hotel charge an extortionate 10 euros per person per morning for a breakfast that was not that exciting. They had a rather poor soggy selection of 'full english breakfast' items (bacon, scrambled eggs, mushrooms) then a selection of cooked meats, cheese, bread, mini pastries (always a winner!), some rather tasty cooked tomato sauce (odd for breakast, huh!), and a small selection of cereals and tortilla. Plenty of coffee and steamed milk was laid on each table. But unfortunately no tea. My boyfriend was most disappointed that there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the bedroom. the hotel restaurant appeared to be somewhat expensive and so we didn't try it. Nearby there were a couple of nice little cafes/pastry shops so we were able to get tasty breakfast much cheaper out of the hotel. The location of the hotel was a bit annoying - 10 minutes walk (turn right out of the hotel and it's a straight line until the roundabout) - to the nearest tube (marques de vadilla) - but didn't greatly interfere with our activities. There was a great bar down the road a few minutes towards the tube, on the opposite side of the road, though i can't unfortunately recall it's name for you. Nice tapas and friendly staff though their english was not good so i had to flick through my phrase book a bit. In the end it was fine and we got what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “good base”
Reviews.Author: bennec
Reviews.Content: We too spent 3 nights here at the beginning and end of a Cosmos tour. Room very clean and good range of toiletries, So easy on the No23 bus to get to central Madrid and buses air coditioned and regular. Watch you dont open the fridge door or you will be billed for a bottle of H2O, Lobby can be hectic at times as used by tour groups but would stay again if I went to Madrid without Cosmos!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Praga -- loved Cafe Parada”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For anyone staying at the Hotel Praga, a real bonus is the Cafe Parada, about one block away. The proprietor of this establishment, Salvatore, speaks perfect English and is always willing to give helpful suggestions and recommendations. This charming little cafe has great homemade food and drinks. Along with this comes Salvatore, who is always dispensing words of wisdom and humor along with delicious cafe con leche. The Hotel Praga is off the beaten path, but places like Cafe Parada make it a more enjoyable local experience. Please stop in the Cafe Parada and say hi to Salvatore!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this after getting a good rate (70euros a double room a night with breakfast) on the net and reading other reviews . Staff varied from very helpful to very unhelpful , room was very good, clean , good bed etc with up to date fittings and good ensuite with excellent toileteries . Nice bar and excellent breakfast with freshly squeezed orange, serrano ham etc . Rooms at back quiet with uninspiring view of flats . Taxi rank outside front of hotel, around 6-7 euros into Plaza Mayor . Would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You might Want to Print This off as I will give you an Honest Opinion to help enjoy your stay. arriving at Madrid Airport it is Huge you get a Monorail to Collect your Lugage , Get outside and get a Taxi loads of them , I made the mistake of booking taxi through expedia could find it took me an Hour and was 40euro , taxi outside would have been 25-30 euro. Hotel praga would rate 3 Star it is very clean rooms nice have mini bar and safe get the key for safe at ckeck inn for 15 euro deposit and 2 euro a day charge. the hotel is located in a residential area with lots of bars and cafes about the hotel bar is basic but nice , dont know a bout the food as we didnt eat in the hotel, The best meal we had is in a great cafe on the right same side as hotel 5 min walk cALLED ORGAZ DONT BE PUT OF WITH the name this place is well used by locals and you can ask for a menu in English , the do a special Deal of Starter + Main+Drink and either desert or a coffee for 11 Euro suberb also grat for breakfast . Back to the hotel right outside is the bus stop get the bus no 23 fair is 1 euro and the last stop is Plazza mayor here you are at the heart of the city in the plazza mayor their is a grate Turist information office , the plazza mayor is nice but select you eating place with care most advertise the price but the all vary shop about a bit first, Best way to see madrid is the open top bus it has 3 diffirent routes for the one price of 14 euro hop on and off all day and it has head set with your language. watch out after midnight as on sunday night we found it near impossible to get a Taxi back to hotel as they were always full took about an hour to get an empty one . a taxi from plazza mayor to hotel will cost 10euro. oh nearly forgot hotel gave us our room that looked into a brick wall at the back , I asked for a change and the did no bother to big front room , their is ones with balconys as well so ask for one we had a grate time here for the weeken and would stay at the praga again

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for a visit to Madrid !”
Reviews.Author: Colne_Lancashire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Hotel Praga in November 2005. We stayed four days during which time we visited the sights in Madrid and around. We can only give praise and positive feedback about our visit to this hotel. The hotel was easy to find with a map downloaded from the internet. The hotel staff were very efficient and speedy when we checked in. We asked for a quiet room on a high floor and we were given exactly what we wanted. You would have thought we were in the hotel on our own ! - it was a great room allocation. Rooms at the front of the hotel were probably more noisy but our room was extremly quiet. The room was of adequate size, well appointed, with a comfortable bed, chairs and table, plenty of storage space and a super bathroom. The size of room wasn't important to us as after a long day walking round Madrid, a nice shower and a comfortable bed were the most important factors ! We didn't eat in the hotel. We bought rolls, ham and other things and had a lovely DIY breakfast in our room before leaving for the day's expedition. We took a kettle and coffee as there wasn't coffee facilities in the room. We can recommend "Museo del Jamon" for super rolls and ham and pastries. There are bars and restaurants in the area around the hotel, but we ate in the city before returning to the hotel. We found some really nice places to eat tapas and meals around the Plaza Major area. For us, the best thing about the Hotel Praga is the location. It isn't in the city centre; it's about 8kms from the city. We like to stay out of the centre and travel in each day. Couldn't be easier from this hotel ! Bus stop outside the hotel ... 20 mins later .. you are virtually in the Plaza Major - only a few minutes walk ! Very reliable, very frequent and cheap ! To summarise, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Praga. We have no negative comments to make. On the basis of our experience, we would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Madrid. We would certianly stay there again if we visited Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on holiday rooms direct for a very good price which is why we chose it. Other reviews seem to indicate the opposite but we found the front desk to be both helpful and pleasant - especially Carlos! Good English spoken on reception as well. Hotel well placed with bus to centre directly outside,and metro about 300 metres walk. You can get from the airport to the hotel by metro for under 2 euros per person, even though on the opposite side of the city. The metro is cheap and efficient and takes you to all the main tourist sights - 10 journey combined metro/bus ticket is 5.8 euros, and this can be shared between travellers. Many tapas bars in the area of the hotel serve breakfast but if you want chat and advice go to La Parada and see Salvatore - 50m from the hotel on the right on the way to the metro - advertises many languages spoken, and it's true.....

Reviews.Title: “not 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: quality not a 4 star like itis suposed. not heating in bedroom, till November, waiters in good need of new uniforms, wallpaper falling of the walls,staff not friendly ....

Reviews.Title: “Praga Pain & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: DnRManchesterEngland
Reviews.Content: The reception desk staff could do with a little bit of training in respect of service with a smile etc. Some of the barstaff were the same and double check your bar tab as mistakes were often made! The hotel itself is very clean and the rooms realy quite good. They were kept clean every day. Rooms at the front get a lot of traffic noise and there are roadworks ongoing! rooms at the back are quiter, but with a lousy view! From the airport we got a taxi outside to the praga for 35 euros, which is not to bad if you are not sure about finding your way there. Once there, come out of the hotel, turn right, cross near the bus stop and walk to the end of the street. Take a left and cross the road. After the news kiosk is the entrance to the metro station- Marques de Vadillo on line 5 (green). Its about a ten/fifteen minute walk and the price and service is excellent. Plenty of shops and friendl bars on the street outside. Try the amusement park and nearby zoo. A short trip by metro and worth it. All in all not a bad place to stay, but could do a lot better if it tried.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Senorita Cocha and dirty rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter_Girl
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hotel Praga in early July. It is your average European hotel that could have been decent. I checked in around 4 pm after a long flight. Check in was prompt; however, when I entered my room I found it had never been cleaned from the people who stayed before me. The bathroom was filthy and dirty towels were thrown all over the place. Bed was not made and trash was all over the room. I went downstairs to get another room and I was told there were no more rooms so I had to wait for it to be cleaned. The staff did not apologize or even act like this was a problem. I then asked to use the phone at the front desk to make a call. In the middle of my call, the receptionist--Srta. Cocha-- hung up the phone while I was in the middle of using it!! I was absolutely furious at her rudeness and she did not even apologize. This hotel is not worth it. It costs ten euro to take a cab to Madrid. I would recommend paying a little more to stay closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: Nigelhu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Praga for two night. Overall the hotel was clean, recently refurbished and comfortable. Located off the tourist trail means a bus ride to the centre of Madrid, or as we did, a 10 minute walk to pick up the Metro. The main road through the neighbourhood is packed with small shops, and tapas bars. The two bars we tried were excellent. We were the only tourists there, struggling with our dictionary to make sense of the menu. At least the waiting staff were friendly. Shame the same can’t be said for the Hotel Praga reception staff. On checking in and on departure the same member of staff advised that breakfast was not included, even though he had taken a photocopy of the reservation confirming that it was. Breakfast itself was reasonable self service. My room faced into one of the light wells which meant no views and slightly dark. However on the upside it was peaceful, being away from the Madrid traffic. I might stay here again, although I would probably seek somewhere closer or with easier access to the centre of town next time.

Reviews.Title: “Service without a smile”
Reviews.Author: Shiubee
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for friendly service from the front desk, you won't find it here. After a long plane ride, we just wanted to check into our hotel room. So being greeted by hotel personnel who barely acknowledged us did not start our vacation in Madrid on a good note. Fortunately, the hotel rooms are indeed nice by European standards. Returning each day to a clean room and a modern marbled bathroom with a good shower just about makes up for the rudeness at the desk. We got a room that faced the street. It's a great way to take a peak at the hubbub in the area, but if you're trying to take a siesta I hope you're a deep sleeper. Drivers in Madrid like to lean on their horn until traffic starts moving, consider yourself warned. If you get a room on the opposite side, you won't get a view, but you won't be assaulted by the traffic noise. Each room comes with a mini bar and fridge, a small safe in the closet and a hairdryer in the bathroom. The hotel is not centrally located, but there's plenty of taxis and Bus 23 is right out front to take you to the main plaza. The convenience of a market just down the street is also a huge bonus. There are plenty of tapas bars in the area to grab a bite to eat, but make sure you plan your late lunch and shopping in the area wisely since siesta time can shut down stores from about 2 to 5 p.m. Don't expect much from the continental breakfast at the hotel. It consists of watery scrambled eggs, boiled bacon and hot dogs, cold cuts, cereal and dry rolls. But then again it is free (as part of your stay there). What you can rely on is a mean, freshly made glass of Sangria at the bar. Salud!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gsrmode
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was nice and comfortable. The hotel is clean. Workers speak little english. There's a super market to the left of the hotel. There's also 2 gyms nearby and i also found it safe to jog everyday around the hotel. You can take the bus right in front of the hotel and it takes you the Plaza Mayor.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location minutes from Plaza Mayor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in a quieter area of the city but catch the No 23 bus at the stop outside the hotel and it will take you to the Plaza Mayor in 10mins and same bus will bring you back to the hotel. The hotel was clean and comfortable with nice bar area, but it is worth exploring Calle Antonio Lopez as there are numerous small tapas bars and the locals were friendly and helpful especially the owner of "La Parada" (Salvatore) 20 metres from hotel who speaks perfect English and will give you any advice you need to know about getting around Madrid.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Praga
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Antonio Lopez 65, 28019 Madrid, Spain
